bibl.title: After the High Roman Fashion? The Temple at Ras el-Soda Seen in Context.
bibl.note: Introduction. - The temple and its contents. - The Egyptian context. - Temples for the Egyptian gods outside Egypt. - A Hellenistic development? - Italian derivation? - Architectural parallels in the East. - Conclusions: the impact of Empire.

bibl.title: The Impact of Imperial Rome on Religions, Ritual and Religious Life in the Roman Empire. Proceedings of the Fifth Workshop of the International Network Impact of Empire (Roman Empire, 200 B.C. - A.D. 476). Münster, June 30 - July 4, 2004

bibl.seg: NAEREBOUT Frits G., After the High Roman Fashion? The Temple at Ras el-Soda Seen in Context.

Lukas DE BLOIS, Peter FUNKE and Johannes HAHN (Edd.), The Impact of Imperial Rome on Religions, Ritual and Religious Life in the Roman Empire. Proceedings of the Fifth Workshop of the International Network Impact of Empire (Roman Empire, 200 B.C. - A.D. 476). Münster, June 30 - July 4, 2004 = Impact of Empire (Roman Empire, 200 B.C. - A.D. 476). 5 (Leiden - Boston, 2006) pp. 122-137.
